item.title: A Method for Obtaining Digital Signatures and Public-Key Cryptosystems
item.description: Authors: R. L. Rivest, A. Shamir, L. Adleman Published: April 1977 URL: https://people.csail.mit.edu/rivest/Rsapaper.pdf Abstract: An encryption method is presented with the novel property that publicly revealing an encryption key does not thereby reveal the corresponding decryption key. This has two important consequences: Couriers or other secure means are not needed to transmit keys, since a message can be enciphered using an encryption key publicly revealed by the intended recipient. Only he can decipher the message, since only he knows the corresponding decryption key.
